title: Not sure where to report people on the forums, this is a bigger deal than in game reporting.
body: So I get in to this game lobby, lo' and behold, Pedophilia, a person's name in game. That is wholly disgusting, what's more: See Picture.

replies.body:
*Because no one's permitted to lie on the internet.*

This is against the universal board rules, and doesn't even belong in this category in the first place. Discussion on player behaviour belongs in misc., or even G&S if you were to stretch it a bit. I suggest you delete that image and the person's summoner name.

I'm not too sure what Riot's stance is on discriminating who's playing the game and who's not based on their personal preferences but if you truly believe that this person is endangering the lives/sanctity of innocents then you should call the police. Of course, they'd probably ask you for more information than just "their user name on a video-game".

You can send in a support ticket to Riot about this, requesting for more information *or* just explaining your concern and see if they'll get the police involved.

Paedophilia is illegal, but you don't have any real proof, do you? For all we know, that could have been a bot.
You are missing the point. I don't need proof to know this is unwholesome and inappropriate. Bot or not, you are still missing the point. Seems to me you are on the wrong side of this issue.

Of course it's unwholesome and inappropriate, but it's not verbal abuse or harassment. It's indecent but not aimed at anyone in that game.

I looked up a bit on the matter, and you're actually right. [Riot do not endorse behaviour like this and encourage players to reports others who do.](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752884-Reporting-a-Player#h1q2)

It's still not something worthy of bringing to the boards, however. You were in game with them and able to report them, soon enough there will be enough reports and their account will be put into question. You can always make a support ticket about it if you're that concerned.

[And it's still against the universal rules to name-call, no matter how severe you may think it is.](http://boards.oce.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/announcements/BjArMH2B-boards-universal-rules)

>Reporting Other Players

>Please don't name names. If you see or hear about another person breaking the rules, send us a ticket directly so we can investigate and take action if necessary. We know that players report publicly with the best intentions, but it often leads to a witchhunt, rarely resulting in a positive discussion. We'll be taking action against players who have violated rules, so please report these players correctly.

>Moderators will be looking for the following:

>* Posts that accuse others of being toxic players in-game
* Posts accusing others of malicious activity
* Posts that accuse others of cheating or using illegal services
* Posts accusing others of trolling in the boards (thereâ€™s a report button for that)

I'd like to make myself perfectly clear: I do not endorse nor condemn paedophilia. It is a crime against nature, yes, but it's not in my right to actively go out and hunt them down. I'm not the law.
I can't believe Riot would allow a name that translates to CHILD SEX. I mean, you can't even name your character Ebola in Warcraft.
